author: NewsBreak Original
title: Boyfriend who threw 50-year-old woman off 'second-story balcony' before dropping 'sturdy,' 50-pound orange recliner on body below is convicted of murder
text:
By Matt Naham ,
2 hours ago
Raymond Antonio Rivera (Killeen County Jail mug shot)
Texas jurors convicted a man this week of murdering his then girlfriend by throwing the victim off the balcony of her apartment in Killeen before hurling an orange recliner as heavy as 50 pounds onto the victim’s body below, leading to a broken neck and numerous other severe injuries that proved fatal in the days that followed.
The June 25, 2020, domestic violence attack and murder that Bell County jurors convicted 39-year-old Raymond Antonio Rivera of committing on Wednesday threatens to put the perpetrator behind bars for a century in the death of 50-year-old Nilsa Maria Arce, a mother of one. The domestic violence murder happened in broad daylight at the Henderson Garden Apartments.
Related Coverage: Although the case began with questions about whether Rivera was competent to face a murder trial, once those concerns abated, the case moved forward, albeit slowly.
The Killeen Daily Herald’s revealing account of witness testimony detailed that the fatal attack unfolded on a Thursday afternoon in plain view of onlookers.
Around lunchtime, witnesses reportedly said, Rivera and Arce were heard arguing before the victim yelled “Aaah!” A thud was audible once Arce fell two stories. But witness Roxanne Rodriguez, who previously lived at the Henderson Garden Apartments, reportedly concluded that what actually killed Arce was the orange recliner Rivera threw from the balcony onto the victim’s face.
The witness reportedly testified that she saw Arce was “breathing very heavily” before Rivera threw the recliner — then all went silent.
“I recall an orange chair landed on her face and then I didn’t hear any more sounds,” Rodriguez reportedly told the jury. Still, the witness reportedly said, Rivera continued throwing objects off the balcony, adding up to what “looked like a pile of trash on top” of the victim.
Jurors also reportedly heard from a U.S. Army veteran and friend of Rodriguez’s who testified to removing a “sturdy” recliner from Arce’s body that day.
“I immediately moved the orange chair and other items off her so I could give first aid,” the witness, identified as Aden Puente Santiago, reportedly said. “As I approached Miss Nilsa, I asked if she was OK and didn’t get a response. I yelled at people to call 911.”
At the start of the case, it was reported that Rivera tried fleeing the murder scene before the Killeen Police Department got there.
It turns out that didn’t work out because the eyewitnesses stepped in and prevented an escape.
“Mr. Raymond jumped off the balcony and ran and I started running after him,” the Army veteran reportedly said in court. “One of my employees picked me up in my car and we continued following him for about two blocks. When he got to an open field, I jumped out. We held him down until KPD arrived.”
Sign up for the Law&Crime Daily Newsletter for more breaking news and updates Arce’s murder was included in the Texas Council on Family Violence’s report on cases of women and men who were victims of “intimate partner violence” in 2020. The report said that Arce died at a hospital two days after the attack.
“Nilsa is survived by her adult daughter,” the report said.
The court docket reviewed by Law&Crime shows that Rivera is scheduled for sentencing before Judge John Gauntt on the afternoon of May 30. The court noted that two hours were blocked off for the hearing.
The post Boyfriend who threw 50-year-old woman off ‘second-story balcony’ before dropping ‘sturdy,’ 50-pound orange recliner on body below is convicted of murder first appeared on Law & Crime .

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in La Crosse County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in La Crosse County, Wisconsin from 1901-2000 was 19.5. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did La Crosse County, Wisconsin experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in La Crosse County, Wisconsin history.

author: @Masrawy
title: آراء طلاب الثانوية بعد الفيزياء والتاريخ بأسيوط: شكاوى من ضيق الوقت | مصراوى
text:
أسيوط - محمود عجمي:
شهدت لجان الثانوية العامة بمحافظة أسيوط، اليوم الخميس، تباينًا في آراء الطلاب حول امتحاني الفيزياء لطلاب الشعبة العلمية، والتاريخ لطلاب الشعبة الأدبية، حيث انقسمت الآراء بين من رأى الامتحان في متناول الطالب المتوسط، ومن اعتبره صعبًا ويحتاج إلى تركيز عالٍ.
ففي امتحان الفيزياء، أعرب عدد كبير من طلاب الشعبة العلمية عن استيائهم من ضيق الوقت، مؤكدين أن الأسئلة جاءت غير مباشرة وتطلبت تفكيرًا عميقًا، خاصة في المسائل المقالية. وأوضح الطلاب هاني عمر، وأحمد محمد، ومحمد عبد الله، من لجنة مدرسة الانتصار الرسمية للغات، أن الامتحان تضمن أسئلة من الكتاب المدرسي، لكنها احتاجت إلى خطوات حل دقيقة، وليس مجرد استنتاج بالنظر، مشيرين إلى أن الامتحان بشكل عام تطلب تركيزًا عاليًا لفهم الأسئلة والإجابة عنها.
أما طلاب الشعبة الأدبية، فقد تباينت آراؤهم حول امتحان مادة التاريخ، حيث أشار بعضهم إلى سهولة الامتحان، بينما رأى آخرون أنه تضمن نقاطًا صعبة وركز بشكل كبير على الفصل السابع المتعلق بالقضية الفلسطينية. وأكد الطلاب عبد الله محمود عباس، وحاتم عبد المنعم، وأحمد علي، أن ضيق الوقت كان من أبرز التحديات، إلى جانب الحاجة إلى تركيز كبير لفهم الأسئلة والإجابة عنها بدقة.

author: Redacción El País
title: Arsenal perdió ante el West Ham y el Liverpool de Luis Díaz se convirtió en el campeón de invierno en Inglaterra
text: Deportes Arsenal perdió ante el West Ham y el Liverpool de Luis Díaz se convirtió en el campeón de invierno en Inglaterra Liverpool jugará ante el Newcastle en la próxima fecha de la Premier League. [Por: Redacción El País](/autor/redaccion-el-pais/) Relevo en el liderato de la Premier League: el Arsenal se vio sorprendido en su estadio al caer 2-0 ante su vecino West Ham, [este jueves en el partido que cerró la 19ª jornada.](https://www.elpais.com.co/deportes/teofilo-gutierrez-aclaro-por-que-estuvo-en-la-fiscalia-de-ibague-acordamos-conciliar-2832.html) El checo Tomas Soucek (minuto 13) y el griego Konstantinos Mavropanos (55) firmaron esta victoria del West Ham bajo la lluvia en el Emirates Stadium. Los ‘Gunners’ se quedan con 40 puntos, a 2 del Liverpool (42), que en el ‘Boxing Day’ del martes había ganado 2-0 en el terreno del modesto Burnley (19º) y se había colocado en cabeza provisionalmente. La derrota del Arsenal ante los ‘Hammers’ hace que el liderato de los pupilos de Jürgen Klopp sea ya en firme, al menos hasta la siguiente jornada, que arranca el sábado. Precisamente, el Arsenal había mantenido el liderato el pasado domingo con un empate 1-1 en el campo del Liverpool. Esta vez tuvo que claudicar en su objetivo ante un West Ham (6º) en puestos europeos. Respecto a otros perseguidores, el Arsenal sigue un punto por delante del Aston Villa (3º), que perdió el martes 3-2 en el campo del Manchester United, pero ve acercarse a tres puntos al Manchester City (4º), [que el miércoles ganó 3-1 en el campo del Everton (17º) y que tiene además un partido disputado menos que el resto de formaciones de la parte alta de la clasificación.](https://www.elpais.com.co/deportes/jhon-arias-y-otros-tres-cracks-fueron-nominados-al-premio-rey-de-america-durisima-competencia-para-el-colombiano-2856.html) El Tottenham (5º), que fue derrotado 4-2 en el campo del Brighton (8º) este jueves, es otro de los perdedores de esta jornada, al salir de la ‘zona Champions’ y quedar ahora a seis puntos del líder Liverpool. En el derbi londinense de este jueves, el primer gol del West Ham vino acompañado de cierta controversia. Jarrod Bowen salvó ‘in extremis’ que un balón se perdiera por la línea de fondo y envió un pase hacia el centro del área, donde apareció Soucek para fusilar el 1-0. El VAR revisó durante una larga espera la jugada para determinar si el balón había llegado a cruzar la línea de fondo o no, antes de que el tanto fuera validado. En la segunda mitad, el segundo del West Ham llegó en un saque de esquina, que Mavropanos cabeceó al fondo de la portería local. En la próxima fecha el Arsenal de Mikel Arteta jugará ante el Fulham en condición de visitante, [ mientras que el Liverpool jugará ante el Newcastle.](https://www.elpais.com.co/deportes/el-reconocimiento-que-la-fifa-le-hizo-a-james-por-su-rendimiento-2838.html) Con información de AFP
